data.title: The Only Place you can get a Monte Cristo Sandwich
data.text: Please request the A Monte Cristo is a fried ham and cheese sandwich, a variation of the French croque-monsieur.

data.title: Breakfast is served!
data.text: I had orange juice that was FRESH squeezed...not frozen or from concentrate. It was delicious. I had a bagel and cream cheese...very average. My husband had pork chops and eggs...the chops were tasty but the potatoes were severely over cooked. There was a nice crowd for breakfast, and some locals so it is a place to try. Easy to find...and yes...on First Street. It is close to Ronald Reagan Presidential Library.

data.title: Quaint family restaurant with classic American food
data.text: My wife & I recently stayed in Simi Valley for 5 days.  We ended up have breakfast at this restaurant 3 times and lunch once.  It has a great homey atmosphere and serves just plain American, basic food - exactly what we were looking for.  Pricing was reasonable.  Service was excellent.  Coffee was good!

data.title: Family feel - food was just fair
data.text: Fair is the best word I can come up with.  Service was good, food just fair.  I ordered baked 1/2 chicken and is was extremely dry like it had been heated in the microwave.  Hubby ordered the "kountry fried steak" - portion size was below average and the quality/taste "okay".  Pricing was reasonable and restaurant was pretty clean.  Don't think we would go back for dinner but would try a breakfast sometime.

data.title: another 'local eatery' which is good value for money & good food
data.text: we went to try this place; the people in there looked like regulars - always a good sign. we were faced with a big choice on the menu.Ordered & the food arrived promptly; plenty of it & all good. no hesitation of putting it on our list of places to go back to & try out some of the other dishes

data.title: Very good breakfast and lunch
data.text: GPS had it under wrong name went anyway staff courteous quick the food was very good  and the prices were low for the quality and quantity of the food

data.title: Best eats in town!!!!
data.text: You want a variety of foods for the family, this is it. My 89 y. o.  Dad loves the senior Meatloaf meal, just the perfect size. I love the baked half chicken, not greasy, they have Mexican, some Italian, salads, breakfast all day. Prices are great. REALmash potatoes with a meal, fresh steamed  veggies or baked potato. Homemade blueberry muffins or cornbread. The list goes on and on. Great place e for out of town family and friends

data.title: My weekly place for Chicken Quisadia
data.text: The "new owner" Frank.  He has been the chef for more that 20 years has his family now helping make a fun pleasant place to eat breakfast, lunch or dinner.  This is simple american food with a Spanish flavor.  You can get what you want at very reasonable prices.  I like Thursdays Chicken Rice soup.

data.title: Family Food
data.text: Breakfast, lunch, or dinner you'll find food for a great value. They even have an "early bird" special for dinner when arriving before six.

data.title: Much better under the new name & management
data.text: My family and I went to eat here years ago when it was under a different name. This time around it was better than before. We were seated right away, the food was delicious, and the service was prompt. She recommended the cinnamon roll and it was yummy! We will be back again soon.

data.title: Always good
data.text: This place has changed hands over the years, but still has been able to maintain quality service, good food, and a nice atmosphere.

data.title: Home cooking!
data.text: I ate breakfast and it was very good.  They had homemade biscuits and gravy.  My husband had the ham and eggs and he enjoyed it.  The wait staff was friendly and very attentive.  I believe our server's name was Juan.  He did a great job keeping our drinks full and making sure we had everything we needed.

data.title: Meeting Old Friends
data.text: It was great to meet some friends here and was just down from our hotel. Service was excellent. The food okay and the atmosphere definitely needs updating. Cobwebs hanging from the old outdated lighting and rafters. I would not recommend this place unless I'm meeting with family that loves this place because of the old memories. Simi Valley overall is really outdated.

data.title: Great breakfast, reasonably priced
data.text: We were in town for an event and having been to this restaurant last year knew we wanted to return!  We ended up having breakfast there 2 days in a row and it was really good!  The staff are all friendly and very efficient.  Even if there's a wait, they turn the tables pretty quickly.  The service was excellent, portions are generous and we will definitely go there again next time we are in town.

data.title: Mrs.
data.text: Good variety of offerings, clean, good service. We've eaten here a number of times, at all times of day. Nothing fancy or special, but food is decent and ample portions.

data.title: Just a great little local restaurant
data.text:
Never thought of reviewing this local favorite of mine, but I should have. We've been coming here for years (starting back when it was the Simi location of Kountry Folks) and have never had a bad meal. We usually come for breakfast on the weekends, and it can get a bit busy, especially after church, but it's not usually a long wait and there's always the counter. Service can sometimes be spotty, but it's more of function of how crowded they are and the speed of the cook(s) in the kitchen. Weekdays and evenings are usually better, crowd wise.

The food has always been good. Nothing fancy - kind of "comfort" food - but tasty, well-prepared and served hot. Even if the service is slow (sometimes), the food always seems to come out at the appropriate temperature.

data.title: Consistent
data.text: Nothing fancy here but the food and service is unusually very good. I normally get diced ham and scrambled eggs. Kids get pancakes. Cinnamon rolls are good too.

data.title: avoid
data.text: We walked in for breakfast, they were not busy. No one was there to seat us so we seated ourselves. We were in a booth right by the door, by the bar seating, where apparent locals just walked in, sat down, were greeted by name and promptly served. While I finally stared at a waitress who was serving the bar customers who came in after us, she said "I will be right there". She started plating their food and finally I went over and asked a man who had seated a family, "Do we have a waitress?" He very boring like motioned to "her", the one who said she would be right over. The proper thing to do was say " I am sorry for the delay, she will be with you shortly but may I start you with some coffee or juice?" We sat there being  ignored for a few more minutes when we got up and left. We found a place called "the egg house" where we were served in the amount of time we waited at First St Family, just to be waited on.

data.title: Counter seating is the best!
data.text: This place is pretty busy on weekends, so my husband and I always sit at the counter so we never have to wait.  The waitress at the counter is always very friendly and our food is served fast.  Great place for home-cooked food!

data.title: Sunday Breakfast
data.text: Well, it's not the most updated restaurant, but the food is good.  We go every Sunday after church and the place is pretty full.  The portions are large and tasty.  Customer service is usually good, however, when really busy sometimes you have to wait a few minutes longer.
